greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle whose rows are sequences of increasing fourth powers: 1; 1,16; 1,16,81; ... .
comment: Reading the triangle by rows produces the sequence 1,1,16,1,16,81,1,16,81,256,..., analogous to A002260.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..120 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: Module[{nn=10,fp},fp=Range[(nn(nn+1))/2]^4;Table[TakeList[fp,{n}],{n,nn}]]//Flatten (* Requires Mathematica version 11 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 29 2020 *)
results.author: _Peter Bala_, Sep 25 2007
